prose.description: Favoriting makes it easy to get to your most-used devices and apps.
prose.howTo: Add to favorites via the menu button near the device or app name.

favorites.title: Favorites
favorites.disabledNoAnchorPos: This setting is disabled beacuse your browser does not support CSS Anchor Positioning.

flatMode.title: Flatten folders
flatMode.desc: On views that support folders, flatten folders to show all apps and desktops in a single list.

iconBackgrounds.title: Icon backgrounds
iconBackgrounds.desc: Add a square background with padding to app and desktop icons for better visibility.

combineTerminalServersMode.title: Combine apps across servers
combineTerminalServersMode.desc: Show only one icon for each app, regardless of the number of terminal servers they are hosted on. If multiple terminal servers are available, a prompt to select one will be shown when launching the app.
combineTerminalServersMode.disabledNoDialogs: This setting is disabled because your browser does not support the requestClose() method on <dialog /> elements

simpleMode.title: Simple mode
simpleMode.desc: Enable simple mode to use a compact, combined, single-page list of apps and desktops.
simpleMode.desc2: The flatten folders option is supported. All other pages and features will be disabled.

hidePorts.title: Hide ports from terminal server names
hidePorts.desc: Hide the terminal server's port from the list of apps and desktops when only one port is used for a hostname

about.title: About
about.appDesc: A web interface for your RemoteApps and Desktops hosted on Windows 10, 11 and Server. Powered by RAWeb.

updates.rateLimited: Failed to check for updates (rate limited). Please try again later.

TerminalServerAliases.title: Configure aliases for terminal servers
TerminalServerAliases.help:
Customize the name of the hosting server that appears in RAWeb or any of the remote desktop clients, or customize the names of the terminal servers for your remote apps and desktops. 

When enabled, you can add aliases for terminal servers. The alias will be used in the RAWeb interface and all workspace clients. 

If disabled or not configured, the terminal server names will be used as-is. 

Example: If you have a terminal server named 'TS1' and you want it to appear as 'Geospatial Analysis Server', you can add an alias with 'TS1' as the key and 'Geospatial Analysis Server' as the value.

App.CombineTerminalServersModeEnabled.title: Combine apps across terminal servers
App.CombineTerminalServersModeEnabled.help:
Controls the availability of the option to combine RemoteApps across terminal servers. 

If enabled, only one icon for each app will be shown, regardless of the number of terminal servers they are hosted on. If multiple terminal servers are available, a prompt to select one will be shown when launching the app. 

If disabled, each terminal server will show its own icon for each app. 

If not configured, each user will be able to control this setting. It will default to being enabled.

App.FavoritesEnabled.title: Enable favorites
App.FavoritesEnabled.help:
Controls the availability of the favorites feature in RAWeb. 

If enabled, users will be able to favorite apps and desktops and access them from the favorites page. 

If disabled, the favorites feature will not be available. 

If not configured, each user will be able to control this setting.

App.FlatModeEnabled.title: Flatten folders
App.FlatModeEnabled.help:
Controls the availability of the flat mode feature in RAWeb. 

If enabled, folders will be flattened to show all apps in a single list. 

If disabled, folders will be shown as-is. 

If not configured, each user will be able to control this setting.

App.IconBackgroundsEnabled.title: Show backgrounds for icons on cards
App.IconBackgroundsEnabled.help:
Controls the availability of the icon backgrounds feature in RAWeb. 

If enabled, a square background with padding will be added to app and desktop icons for better visibility. The square background is only added when the display mode is 'card'. 

If disabled, icons will not have backgrounds. 

If not configured, each user will be able to control this setting.

App.SimpleModeEnabled.title: Only show a combined list of apps and desktops
App.SimpleModeEnabled.help:
Controls the availability of the simple mode feature in RAWeb. 

If enabled, a compact, combined, single-page list of apps and desktops will be shown instead of separate tabs for desktops and apps. 

If disabled, the full RAWeb interface will be available. 

If not configured, each user will be able to control this setting. 

This setting only has an effect when

App.HidePortsEnabled.title: Hide ports from terminal server names
App.HidePortsEnabled.help:
Controls whether the terminal server's port will be hidden from the list of apps and desktops when only one port is used for a hostname. 

If enabled, the port will be hidden from the terminal server name in the list of apps and desktops. 

If disabled, the port will be shown in the terminal server name. 

If not configured, each user will be able to control this setting.

RegistryApps.Enabled.title: Show RemoteApps listed in the registry
RegistryApps.Enabled.help:
Controls whether RemoteApps listed in the registry will appear in the list of apps. 

If enabled, RemoteApps listed in the registry will be shown in the apps list. 

If disabled or not configured, RemoteApps listed in the registry will not be shown. 

RemoteApps can be added to the registry using RemoteApp Tool. The 'TSWebAccess' option must be set to 'Yes' for the RemoteApp to be included by RAWeb.

RegistryApps.FullAddressOverride.title: Override the full address for generated RDP files for RemoteApps listed in the registry
RegistryApps.FullAddressOverride.help:
Replace the default 'full address' in generated RDP files for registry RemoteApps. By default, the 'full address' is formed by the terminal server's IPv4 address and RDP port. 

If enabled, the 'full address' will be set to the value of the origin option. 

If disabled or not configured, the full address will not be changed from the default.

The origin option should be a well-formed origin, such as https://example.com:3389. The port is optional, and if not specified, the default RDP port (3389) will be used by most clients. 

This option is useful when the terminal server is behind a reverse proxy or should be accessed via a specific hostname or IP address.

RegistryApps.AdditionalProperties.title: Add additional RDP file properties to RemoteApps listed in the registry
RegistryApps.AdditionalProperties.help:
Specify RDP file properties to be appended to RDP files generated for RemoteApps listed in the registry. 

If enabled, the specified properties will be added to the RDP file. 

If disabled or not configured, no additional properties will be added. 

The properties should be specified exactly as they would appear in the RDP file. Specify one property at a time. The properties will be added to the RDP file as-is, so ensure they are valid RDP properties. 

Descriptions of properties are available at https://kimmknight.github.io/rdpfileeditor.

Workspace.ShowMultiuserResourcesUserAndG.title: Place multi-user resources in virtual folders with the associated user or group name
Workspace.ShowMultiuserResourcesUserAndG.help:
Controls whether user and group resources will be placed into virtual folders with the associated user or group name in the workspace feed. 

If enabled or not configured, user and group resources will be placed in a virtual folder matching the associated user or group name. 

If disabled, the resources will be placed in the root virtual folder. 

For example, a resource in the '/multiuser-resources/users/kimmknight/tools' folder will be placed in a virtual folder named '/kimmknight/tools' when enabled or not configured and '/tools' when disabled.

UserCache.Enabled.title: Enable the user cache
UserCache.Enabled.help:
Controls whether the user cache is enabled. Enabling the user cache allows logins to occur even when the domain controller cannot be reached by RAWeb. 

With the cache enabled, logins can only occur if the account has previously signed in to RAWeb while the domain controller could be reached or if the account has previously signed in the the device that hosts RAWeb. 

The cache is stored in a SQLite database at "App_Data\usercache.sqlite". The cache contains username, domain, user SID, full name, and groups (SIDs and names). 

The cache is only created and updated when this policy is enabled. The cache is not deleted if this policy is disabled after previosly being enabled. 

If enabled, the user cache is used when the domain controller cannot be reached. 

If disabled or not configured, the user cache is never used.

PasswordChange.Enabled.title: Allow users to change their password via RAWeb
PasswordChange.Enabled.help:
Controls whether users can change their password via RAWeb. 

This feature does not work if a user does not have the ability in Active Directory to change their password. It will also not work if the raweb application pool does not have permission to access user principals or directory entries. This feature is only supported for local accounts and accounts in the same domain as the machine with RAWeb installed. 

This feature does not control a user's ability to change their password by pressing Ctrl + Alt + End once connected to a remote session. 

If enabled or not configured, users will be able to change their password via the 'Change a password' page. 

If disabled, the 'Change a password' page will not be available.

App.Alerts.SignedInUser.title: Configure alerts or announcements at the top of every route for signed-in users
App.Alerts.SignedInUser.help:
Configure custom alerts to be displayed at the top of the web client. 

If enabled, alerts will be shown to users if they are sign in. 

If disabled or not configured, no alerts will be shown. 

Alerts may contain a title, message, and hyperlink. Multiple alerts may be displayed. The link will appear at the end of the alert message on a new line and will open in a popup window or new tab. The link will not appear unless the text and URL are specified.

getProtocolApp.title: Get the Remote Desktop Protocol Handler app
getProtocolApp.message: To connect to this resource via rdp://, you need the Remote Desktop Protocol Handler app installed on your device. You can get it from the Microsoft Store.
getProtocolApp.message2: Once you have installed the app, click continue.

getWindowsApp.title: Get Windows App
getWindowsApp.message: To connect to this resource via rdp://, you need Windows App installed on your device. You can get it from the {{store}}.
getWindowsApp.message2: Once you have installed the app, click continue.

securityError503.title: Security Error 5003
securityError503.message: The service worker failed to install because the SSL certificate is not trusted by your device. Add the certificate to the trusted root certification authorities store on this computer or configure RAWeb to use a trusted certificate. Performance and functionality may be limited. Offline feaures are unavailable.

securityError503.title: Your credentials are at risk
securityError503.message: This page is not secure. A malicious actor could steal your password.
